thread.title: Chief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve
thread.title_full: Chief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve

author: KNS
title: Chief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve
text: J&KChief Justice of J&K Inspires Conservation at Chatlam Wetland Reserve By KNS Posted on Dec 29, 2023 | Updated on Dec 29, 2023 Share Tweet Share Srinagar, Dec 29 (KNS): In a remarkable display of commitment to environmental stewardship, Justice N. Kotiswar Singh, the Chief Justice of Jammu and Kashmir, presided over a birding event at the picturesque Chatlam Wetland Reserve in Pampore. The event aimed not only to appreciate the diverse avian life but also to rally the community and students towards active participation in conservation efforts. During the event, Chief Justice Singh emphasized the critical role each individual plays in preserving the delicate balance of nature. He encouraged students and community members alike to embrace a proactive approach to conservation, underscoring the significance of protecting vital ecosystems like Chatlam Wetland Reserve. As the Chief Justice observed various bird species in their natural habitat, he shared insights into the symbiotic relationship between biodiversity and a healthy environment. His presence served as a catalyst for heightened awareness, fostering a sense of responsibility among attendees towards the region's rich ecological heritage. The birding event at Chatlam Wetland Reserve, led by the Chief Justice, stands as a testament to the judiciary's commitment to broader societal issues. It not only celebrated the diverse birdlife of the region but also sought to ignite a collective sense of duty towards preserving the natural wonders that contribute to the cultural and environmental identity of Jammu and Kashmir.(KNS) Related Categories:Sports Share Tweet Share Recommended for you Lt Governor calls upon youth to build ‘Viksit Bharat’ Secretary YSS chairs preliminary meeting of Khelo India Winter Games PS Shergari recognized among top three Police Stations in Country
